result.execSummary:
The defendant Soukpasong Manavong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Soukpasong Manavong was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Soukpasong Manavong is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Soukpasong Manavong was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 95CF1918 and 95CF1919.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $375  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CKT.
Sex Offender Registry Required.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter: Nadine Ripp - am; Jenny Poirior - pm.
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorneys Adam Matthias Welch and Payal Khandhar. Diane Louise Schlipper and Stephanie Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE reports new discovery was received. Requested sanctions as to discovery violations put on record by DE. Argument. Ct orders sanctions. Jury enters at 8:49 AM. Marlene J. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Exhibit 7 - Marlene J's CV, marked and received. Exhibit 8 - SANE report, marked. State moves to admit exhibit 8. Side bar at 8:56 AM. Ends at 8:57 AM. Exhibit 8 admitted. Diagram to not be published. Side bar at 8:57 AM. Ends at 9:03 AM. Cross. Re-direct. Re-cross. State rests. Jury excused for breat at 9:37 AM. Jury enters at 9:59 AM. Baysy M. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Welch. Cross by ADA Hilton. Deputy Steve D. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Welch. Cross by ADA Schlipper. Det Jason W. duly sworn and testified. Cross Direct by Atty Welch. Jury excused for break at 10:29 AM. Jury enters at 10:54 AM. P. B. duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Welch.  Cross by ADA Schlipper. Side bar at 11:08 AM. Ends at 11:11 AM. Jury excused for break at 11:12 AM. Jury enters at 1:00 PM. DE duly sworn and testified. Direct by Atty Welch. Cross by ADA Schlipper. Jury excused for break at 1:06 PM. Enters at 1:12 PM. DE rests. Gregory G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Hilton. Jury excused for break at 1:16 PM. Court holds jury instruction conference. Parties agree to 100, 157, 150, 147, 148, 145, 115, 2107 w/255A, 115, 2102E, 103, 155, 300, 340, 190, 195, 140, 160, 460, 484, 515. Jury enters at 1:56 PM. Jury instructions given. Closings. Final jury instructions given. Two alternate jurors excused at 3:52 PM. Bailiffs sworn. Jury excused for deliberations at 3:55 PM. Parties convene to answer juror question at 5:03 PM. DE objects to juror request. Parties answer juror question number 2 at 7:27 PM by phone. Court and parties telephonically discuss juror illness. Parties agree to move jurors to larger jury room. Jury enters with verdict at 8:55 PM. Verdict: Ct 4 - not guilty, ct 3 - not guilty, ct 2 - not guilty, ct 1 - guilty. Jury polled. Jury excused at 8:59 PM. State moves for judgment on the verdict. Court orders. State requests PSI, ordered. SEH to be set in approximately 60 days.
Exhibits 5 and 6 may be introduced into evidence without further foundation
Exhibit 3 and 4 may be introduced into evidence without further foundation
14 jurors

Side bar at 10:10 AM. Ends at 10:10 AM. J. H. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Side bar at 10:15 AM. Ends at 10:16 AM. Cross. Jury released for break at 10:20 AM. Jury enters at 10:41 AM. Jacquelynn B. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Cross. Gregory G. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Cross. Side bar at 10:57 AM. Ends at 10:57 AM. Jury excused for lunch at 10:59 AM. Exhibit 3 - Safe Harbor interview DVD, marked. Exhibit 4 - transcript of Safe Harbor interview, marked. Exhibit 5 - DVD of revocation hearing, marked. Exhibit 6 - Transcript of revocation hearing, marked. DE moves for admission of exhibits 3, 4, 5 and 6, no objection, received. Jury enters at 12:41 PM. Det. Cheryl P. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Side bar at 12:51 PM. Ends at 12:52 PM. State request to publish exhibit 3, no objection, granted. Jury excused for break at 1:52 PM. Jury enters at 2:20 PM. C. T. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. DE identified. Side bar at 2:33 PM. Ends at 2:37 PM. Cross. Re-direct. Carolyn T. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Cross. Re-direct. Re-cross. Side bar at 3:53 PM. Ends at 3:53 PM. Jury excused for the day at 3:54 PM.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorneys Adam Matthias Welch and Payal Khandhar. Diane Louise Schlipper and Stephanie Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State orally amends language under ct 4, no objection, amended. DE MIL #6 held in abeyance: Court continues to hold in abeyance. Jury panel enters at 9:40 AM. State's Request for jury instructions

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Diane Louise Schlipper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. MIL and Ludwig hearing. Ludwig: last offer: plea 1 count (DE's choice). DRI remaining counts. State to cap at 10 i.c. cc to revocation. DE declines offer and requests to proceed to jury trial. State's MIL: State withdraws 4b. DE does not object to any of the State's MIL. Ct grants 1 and all subsections, 2 - 3f court will follow rules of evidence. 3g -4d granted. 4b withdrawn. 4e: granted in part. 5a: denied. Stipulation as to prior convictions. DE's MIL: 1 - objection, granted. 2 - granted. 3 - victim can be used at closing but at no other time during the trial. 4 - objection, denied. 5 - granted. 6 - held in abeyance. 7 - granted. 8 - granted. 9 - granted. 10 - withdrawn, granted. 11 - granted. Stipulation that no testimony or evidence regarding cutting is allowed. Each side to get 6 total strikes. Court will seat 26. Court proceedure discussed with parties. Note taking allowed. No jury questions. Court orders video admissible.
